intro: Maoutia platistigma, commonly known as the narrow-leaved maoutia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale pink to white, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
